summary: Twin brothers Raja and Prem are separated at birth after their father exposes a kingpin and his racket. They eventually come together to battle a smuggling ring and save their family from certain doom.

reviews.content: Nowhere near the original. Watch it only if you're a fan of the lead cast.
This film is very boring, awful.the actingof Varun Dhawan is very poor most of the time he looks doing over acting.Wacthing this film means making insane your self.
This is the funniest and entertaining film i have seen
Best movie ever! I watched it twice within 12 hours. The songs are top notch too!
leave your brains at Home but made me wanna watch the original again
Hardly any improvement on what was quite a low bar set by the original.
Poor Star Cast. An Epic Ruined with Remake. Sad.. Ammi Jaan kaha karti thi "Movie banane se pehle acting sikh lo Varun Sir"

Judwaa 2

The director wastes our time in creating different episodes of the "twin" crisis and forgets to put anything in it except for some lame one liners. not only is the movie sexist but also has some major flaws in script and execution.
Amazing movie must watch everyone great binding package of laughter for families and couples strongly recommend everyone to watch this for one time.
Two and half hours of nonsense! No morals, treats women as an object. The movie doesn't make sense even for a second. Don't understand how films like this become a hit in India.
silliest movie I've ever watched.. I left the movie early - thats how bad it was!
Pretty good movie it makes you laugh whistle and enjoy the movie
So predictable, signature bollywood movie, lots of song, replays and over reactions..  Overall watch only if you fond of bollywood
'Judwaa 2' is cringe worthy cinema at its best, which despite Varun Dhawan's spectacular act is a letdown due to its uninteresting old fashioned humor.
I enjoyed it and even my friends.?? and the last scene the entry of bhaijan was awesome..
Faltu movie...copy paste and release same $$$$ again. Keep taking advantage of foolish audiences Bollywood !
